definition: to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: Shocking footage from China has captured the moment the outer wall of a high-rise building 'peels' off and crashes to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 令人震惊的视频显示中国高层建筑的外层剥落的情景。

sentences.english: The spalling reason of the roller surface for cold rolling is complicated.
sentences.chinese: 冷轧工作辊表面发生剥落掉块的原因是复杂的。

sentences.english: The paint on the wall has peeled off.
Refractory steel often occurs pulverization and peeling phenomena.
sentences.chinese: 耐热钢在还原性气氛下工作时，常发生粉化剥落现象。
耐渣锓蚀，强度高，抗剥落。

sentences.english: Lift one edge of each skid strip with a putty knife and peel it from roof panel .
sentences.chinese: 用油灰刀抬高防滑带的一边并且从车顶饰板上剥落它。

sentences.english: The white paint was scaling from the brick walls.
sentences.chinese: 砖墙上的白漆已开始剥落。

sentences.english: The failure mechanism of plating Mo layer was flaking off.
sentences.chinese: 镀钼层的失效破坏以镀层剥落为主。

sentences.english: However, the alumina layers spall as the temperature increases.
sentences.chinese: 但是，氧化铝层剥落的温度升高。

sentences.english: The weathering could split the rock off.
sentences.chinese: 风化可把岩石一片片地剥落掉。

sentences.english: The rapid propagation of these cracks along the white layer can develop brittle delamination of white layer.
sentences.chinese: 裂纹在白层内的快速扩展造成表面白层的脆性剥落。

sentences.english: There appear cracks and chunk peelings in the chrome-plated layer of these piston rings.
sentences.chinese: 活塞环镀铬层有裂纹和块状剥落。

sentences.english: The house groaned and the plaster came loose.
The bark of some trees exfoliates.
sentences.chinese: 某些树的皮会成片状剥落。

sentences.english: One of the most obvious effects is chapped skin and flaky skin.
sentences.chinese: 最明显的就是使我们的皮肤干裂剥落。

definition: to drop off/to come off/to lose (hair etc)/to omit (a character when writing)
variant of 斑駁|斑驳[ban1 bo2]
to peel off/mottled/to fail an exam/to be demoted
to split open/to dehisce (of fruit or cotton bolls, to split open)
to disintegrate/to shatter into small pieces
to rupture/to burst open/to break up
mottled and peeling off in places
